column5: Not my photo (it was sent to me) but it's a scenario I know well.  Cats like roe. Be careful when tying roe bags!  (click the pic to make it larger)
Cat Caviar. My wifes cat eats better than I do.

My Golden Ret. 2 years ago , found and ate a roe bag on shore with the hook  still in it. Off to the vet and the x-rays showed the hook and 3 sinkers on the line, in the picture of her stomach.  A $ 2600.00  operation  later and the hook and sinkers were removed.   Now when I stream fish I have to scout around and pick up all the crap left behind by other fisherpeople before I release the dog.

We were night fishing for Bullheads this spring on Nanticoke creek when a Lab started screaming, she got a treble hook in her paw and it was buried. No way could anyone get near her to even see it. I cringe still today at the sound the poor puppy made.  Off to the emerg Vets, $$$$$$. Someone left the treble hook in the grass for someone to find. Usually that someone is a child or pet. Please clean up after ourselves.
